To help with his water bill, John can repair all his pipes. When pipes are damaged or leaking, water can be wasted, leading to higher water bills. By repairing the pipes, John can ensure that there are no leaks or damages, thereby reducing water waste and ultimately lowering his water bill. 

Options (A), (B), and (C) are all incorrect because they involve actions that actually waste water. Dripping the sink at night, taking a bath twice a day, and flushing the toilet more all result in increased water usage, which would lead to higher water bills. Therefore, option (D) is the correct answer as it focuses on preventing water wastage.

To help save on his water bill, John can repair all his pipes. This is the correct answer because leaking or broken pipes can cause water to be wasted unnecessarily. By fixing any leaks or issues with the pipes, John can ensure that he is not using excessive amounts of water, which will help reduce his water bill.

Option (B) is also incorrect because taking a bath twice a day would use more water than necessary. Option (C) is incorrect because flushing the toilet more often would also waste water.
